definition: Panmunjom village on the DMZ between North and South Korea
pinyin: Ban3 men2 dian4 ting2 zhan4 cun1

sentences.english: One of the first conditions as a result of the Armistice was the complete abrogation of the treaty.
sentences.chinese: 第一個條件，由於停戰協定的，是完全廢除該條約。

sentences.english: Ban also said it was time for Israel to consider a unilateral ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 潘基文也說現在是時候讓以色列考慮單方面的停戰。

sentences.english: Soon after this, Richard made a truce with the Saracens.
sentences.chinese: 這事過後不久，理查就和撒拉遜人停戰和好。

sentences.english: A white flag is the universal symbol for truce.
sentences.chinese: 白旗是停戰的普遍象徵。

sentences.english: After several rounds of negotiation, the two countries finally agreed on a cease-fire.
sentences.chinese: 經過幾輪談判，兩國終於休兵停戰。

sentences.english: The Israeli government also rejected the truce proposal.
sentences.chinese: 以色列政府也拒絕停戰的建議。

sentences.english: A political conference was held the following year, as provided in the armistice agreement .
sentences.chinese: 按照停戰協定的規定，翌年召開了政治會議。

sentences.english: But at least an armistice will mean that men who would have died will now live.
sentences.chinese: 但至少，停戰意味着那些原本要死的人逃過一劫。

sentences.english: There was a cease-fire in 1953, but no peace agreement.
sentences.chinese: 雖然1953年朝鮮停戰了，但並沒有達成和平協議。

sentences.english: The states formed the Trucial States Council in 1960.
sentences.chinese: 各國於1960年成立了停戰諸國委員會。

sentences.english: Current joint military exercises between South Korea and the United States during the anniversary have led to increased rhetoric from North Korea.
sentences.chinese: 在停戰日期間的美韓聯合軍事演習更北韓了好戰言論。

sentences.english: After the term of the armistice expired in 1590, Russian troops moved in to take them back.
sentences.chinese: 在1590年停戰期滿後，露西亞軍隊揮師收復失地。

sentences.english: HORACE: We had a truce with these people. You don't understand.
sentences.chinese: 我們跟那些人有停戰協議，你不瞭解情況。

sentences.english: Soldiers from the two armies stopped fighting and fraternized on Christmas Day.
sentences.chinese: 兩軍士兵在聖誕節停戰並稱兄道弟。

definition: to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
to hold a (business) meeting/to start negotiations
North and South Korea/bilateral Korean relations
Treaty of Shimonoseki (1895), concluding the First Sino-Japanese War 甲午戰爭|甲午战争[Jia3 wu3 Zhan4 zheng1]
